fields.description:
Hi, 

We start to experiencing an issue since May 2nd:
- After a pull request is created, following commit doesn't show up as updates anymore.
-- Which affects the pull request review process quite a lot.
- This works fine before.

There is several incident happened recently just FYI:
- We met a out of disk space issue in the morning of May 2nd, but was fixed 10 minutes later, not sure if this will related to the issue we met above.
- We deployed a home brew stash hook plugin yesterday also, which it does is just a post-receive hook try to sync between git repositories. It is unlikely this is the cause of the issue, but we are not sure. And we have disable the plugin, however the issue still remains.

Hope we could get the support to speed the trouble shooting ...
fields.summary: After a pull request is created, following commit doesn't show up as updates anymore.

fields.description:
This is caused by a combination of a Solaris [bug|http://bugs.sun.com/view_bug.do?bug_id=5049299] (which does not [overcommit memory|http://opsmonkey.blogspot.com.au/2007/01/linux-memory-overcommit.html] like Linux) and another in [processutils|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-processutils/overview]:


* Stash's _BaseCommand_ forks process using processutils's _ExternalProcessBuilder_, which creates instances of _ExternalProcess_;
* The _start()_ of the _ExternalProcess_ [implementation|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-processutils/src/f8e34816f4e1960217a3646aeccb642f033fbb00/src/main/java/com/atlassian/utils/process/ExternalProcessImpl.java?at=atlassian-processutils-1.5.9] fails internally because of the Solaris bug, but the IO exception is [swallowed and stored in a local field|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-processutils/src/f8e34816f4e1960217a3646aeccb642f033fbb00/src/main/java/com/atlassian/utils/process/ExternalProcessImpl.java?at=atlassian-processutils-1.5.9#cl-272],
* after it has invoked _start()_ on the wrapper, any subsequent call by _BaseCommand_ on the wrapper's _finish()_ method [immediately returns|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-processutils/src/f8e34816f4e1960217a3646aeccb642f033fbb00/src/main/java/com/atlassian/utils/process/ExternalProcessImpl.java?at=atlassian-processutils-1.5.9#cl-416] because its internal _process_ field was never assigned (due the exception raised in _start()_, which prevented the internal assignment of the _process_ field and is still _null_).

Thus the [internal exception|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-processutils/src/f8e34816f4e1960217a3646aeccb642f033fbb00/src/main/java/com/atlassian/utils/process/ExternalProcessImpl.java?at=atlassian-processutils-1.5.9#cl-37] is never used and is discarded.

As a result, any Git command created by Stash fails silently, without any error.
fields.summary: Forking Git commands fails silently on Solaris when there is not enough memory

fields.description:
In our company we use Golden Gate to replicate databases. Our DBAs found following issues which prevent Golden Gate from replicating schema used by Stash:

1. Indexes and constraints with system generated names are not supported

CONSTRAINT_TYPE TABLE_NAME 
------------------------------- ------------------------------
P                              AO_CFE8FA_BUILD_STATUS 
P                              AO_FB71B4_PUBLIC_KEY 
P                              AO_6978BB_RESTRICTED_REF 
P                              AO_6978BB_PERMITTED_ENTITY 
U                              WEIGHTED_PERMISSION 
P                              PLUGIN_SETTING 

P - Primary Key
U - Unique Key

Solution: Primary/Unique keys and indexes assigned to them should be named


2. Tables With No Primary Key or Unique Index
Table Rows
------------------------ --------
CS_ATTRIBUTE 906
HIBERNATE_UNIQUE_KEY 1
HT_STA_PR_ACTIVITY 
ID_SEQUENCE 14

Solution: Primary or Unique keys should be created for those tables.
fields.summary: Enable Oracle Golden Gate replication
The error in the log refers to a documentation page that does not exist

fields.description: While evaluating different git repo management solutions, I evaluated Gitolite.  One feature of Gitolite that I really thought was cool was that I could configure wild card paths for branch/tag namespaces (ie: /CREATOR/<branch_name> where CREATOR is the user that creates and pushes the branch the first time)  I could set branches in a CREATOR's namespace to only be RW for the CREATOR and R only for everyone else.  It would nice if Stash could also support this ability.
fields.summary: Wild card Namespaces for Branches

fields.description:
SSH session hangs or terminates!
With the SSH deployed with GIT 18. we get the following from a debug trace....

{noformat}
$ ssh -T git@github.com
debug1: Authentication succeeded (publickey).
debug1: channel 0: new [client-session]
debug2: channel 0: send open
debug1: Entering interactive session.
debug2: callback start
debug2: client_session2_setup: id 0
debug2: channel 0: request pty-req confirm 0
debug2: channel 0: request shell confirm 0
debug2: fd 3 setting TCP_NODELAY
debug2: callback done
debug2: channel 0: open confirm rwindow 2097152 rmax 32768
dispatch_protocol_error: type 100 seq 8
From SSH running under the latest CygWin we get...
debug1: Authentication succeeded (publickey).
Authenticated to lhujira01v ([10.235.112.135]:9094).
debug1: channel 0: new [client-session]
debug3: ssh_session2_open: channel_new: 0
debug2: channel 0: send open
debug1: Entering interactive session.
debug2: callback start
debug2: fd 3 setting TCP_NODELAY
debug3: packet_set_tos: set IP_TOS 0x10
debug2: client_session2_setup: id 0
debug2: channel 0: request pty-req confirm 1
debug2: channel 0: request shell confirm 1
debug2: callback done
debug2: channel 0: open confirm rwindow 2097152 rmax 32768
debug2: channel_input_status_confirm: type 99 id 0
debug2: PTY allocation request accepted on channel 0
debug2: channel_input_status_confirm: type 100 id 0
shell request failed on channel 0
{noformat}

And the same results from the SSH client on the Red Hat Enterprise server that Stash is installed on.

This is expected because it should not be possible to get a remote shell via Stash (we use http://mina.apache.org/sshd-project/index.html for SSH). SSH is implemented such that it supports running a set of 3 specific git commands and "who am i" for troubleshooting. In addition, users can build plugins to integrate with our SSH support to add more commands if they want to.

However, it would be nice to have a more meaningful error message; It would be preferable if the message comming back from the service was more meaningful - i.e. "Shell access not supported! Please issue Git commands only?" because that could save a couple of hours of frustration trying to figure this out :-)
fields.summary: User friendly error message for git access to Stash via SSH

fields.description: The "commits" view from BitBucket is very similar to the "Commits" view from Stash. However the "Source" view from BB is slightly different from the "Files" view from Stash. fields.description:
When viewing old pull requests, sometimes a recurring "Activity not found" error is displayed when loading the overview. This is caused by commits which have comments on them being garbage collected, due to a configuration bug in Stash 1.3. That issue was fixed in 2.1, but some pull requests had already had their commits removed.

The removed commits will prevent Stash from displaying diff context for comment activities, but it should not prevent viewing the pull request itself.
fields.summary: Viewing old pull requests sometimes shows "Activity not found"

fields.description: The {{scripts.cfg}} file (introduced in #40cf2d3) is only required to display information when using the startup scripts. It requires information to be duplicated and unnecessarily complicates Stash customisations. We should get rid of the file and solve this in a better/DRY way.
fields.summary: Remove the need to have a separate scripts.cfg configuration file.

Even if I directly add my user it will not let me push.

I can merge a pull request via the web interface. I am not sure what else I can do to make it work.

fields.description:
Currently when Stash's hook scripts for a given repo are missing that fact is silently ignored and as a result all the plugin hooks configured for the repo _will not_ execute. 

I am not sure about other scenarios (e.g. no exec permission etc.), but generally the fact that the hooks were unable to execute must be detected and dealt with somehow, e.g.:
* big fat ERROR in logs
* notifying admin somehow
* warning message on the hook settings page
* whatever else to make sure the admin is aware of this (and perhaps link/suggestion to raise a support request)
fields.summary: Detect that Stash is unable to execute its hooks scripts and do something about it

China guys are changing their names to an American ones to simplify it for us, but their emails stay the same with the original names. We are talking on more than 350000 users here. There is got to be a better way.

Possible solutions:

- Sortable columns

fields.description:
Instructions:
- Enable the SSO plugin in {{stash-config.properties}}:
{noformat}
# Whether SSO support should be enabled or not. Regardless of this setting SSO authentication 
# will only be activated when a Crowd directory is configured in Stash that is configured 
# for SSO.
plugin.auth-crowd.sso.enabled=true
{noformat}
- Add the Crowd directory to Stash.
- Any further navigation will result in a NPE.

Moving forward:
- Disabled the plugin parameter.
- Restarted Stash without issues.

Finally:
- Entered a value for SSO Domain.
- Enabled the plugin.
- Restarted Stash successfully.
- Entered a SSO domain in Crowd.
fields.summary: NPE with SSO plugin enabled & Crowd directory set without SSO Domain
Introduce ability to transform hook settings on save/load

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
For installations that use delegated LDAP for authentication users will be created in Bitbucket Server on their first login. This causes problem for plugins that provide authentication based on a custom token (e.g. SSO token / Kerberos).

If the plugin is able to resolve the username from the token, but the user has never logged in to Bitbucket Server, authentication will fail because the StashUser cannot be found.

*Migrating to a Delegated Directory in Bitbucket*
(!) While this is possible, there is one caveat which is that users must login for the first time via the UI in order to synchronise user groups and permissions. This means that if you have users who have access keys in their user profile, they will not be able to push using those access keys until they login via the UI or perform an HTTP(s) git operation. 


h3. Suggested Solution
Bitbucket Server should provide a way to sync a remote user based on the username.


h3. Workaround
Login to Bitbucket Server for the user to be authenticated.
fields.summary: Synchronise user on demand for delegated LDAP

fields.description:
At the moment we can choose to delete the branch when we merge a pull request, but when we decline a pull request, there's no such option and we have to manually delete the branch using a Git client if we want to.

[ Update on 2013-04-15 to make the request more clear to @Jens Schumacher from Atlassian ]
For example, when I want to **accept** a pull request by clicking on the "merge" button, I get this:

!merge-branch.png!

As you can see, there's a checkbox there that will make sure the branch gets deleted after the merge succeeds.

However, when I **decline** a pull request by clicking on the "decline" button (which is the next button on the right after "merge"), I get a very similar UI:

!decline-pull-request.png!

But as you can see, there's no checkbox there to allow me to choose if I want to delete the branch or not.
fields.summary: Ability to delete branches when declining a pull request

fields.description:
During the process of reviewing pull requests, it is common that the reviewer will add comments to the code asking for changes and will only merge the pull request after it has been updated with all the changes requested.

A pull request can remain open for several days or weeks (specially if it is a spike that has a big impact and will need thinking and testing from a lot of people).

The issue we have, is that we end up having a lot of pull requests open at a time, and it is very hard to know which pull requests are waiting on the developer to update it, and the ones that are awaiting a review.

We need to have a new state in the pull request that indicates that it is "Waiting for updates" from the developer so we can differentiate which pull requests are "really" waiting for the reviewer, and which pull requests are waiting for the developer to incorporate the reviewer's comments.

!WaitForUpdates.png!

With that new state implemented, I would expect that:

1-) "My Pull Requests" flyout of the reviewers, shows only the "pending review"-pull requests - the ones that are not "waiting for updates" from the developer (and help withthe [psychic weight|http://www.hanselman.com/blog/PsychicWeightLifeIsPending.aspx] of having the red icon showing we have 25 pull requests to review, when we actually we may have already done 15 of them and these are waiting for the developer)

!MyPullRequests.png!


2-) When a developer updates the pull request with a new commit, the "waiting for developer" state/flag is removed so that the reviewer can see this pull requests in his "inbox" again (similar to what the "Stash Unapprove Reviewers Hook" plugin does)

3-) The "Pull Requests" list on the repository allows me to see the status of each pull request

!AllPullRequests.png!
fields.summary: Add "Waiting for update" status on Pull Requests so reviewer knows he is waiting on the developer

fields.description:
We are slowly migrating a lot of projects currently in TFS to Git/Stash, and all of our projects have an identical set of permissions for different kinds of branches (convention based on branch names), and every time we migrate a new project, it takes several minutes to manually insert each permission.

It would be very helpful for us, if we could copy the permissions of one repository to another.

This could be something as simple as downloading the settings of a repository into a file, and then uploading this file into another repository to replace its settings.
fields.summary: Ability to import/export branch permissions (or copy permissions from one repository to another)

fields.description:
Use case (download of individual raw files):

It is nice to browse repositories with a web browser, but as soon as you want to download a file, you surely don't want to save it locally. Instead one would expect is a link that works with everything: {{wget}}, {{curl}}, etc.

Currently, an attempt to download through {{wget}} directs to a login page which does fail, of course. Instead, file downloads should be limited for a certain time, but then the link should contain a hash that doesn't need a login. Just the way you do it on github, sourceforge etc.

Something within these lines:
{noformat}
curl -u user:password "https://stash.atlassian.com/.....pom.xml?at=b88d2e7f8515dd13a822ee86b508f59cfe33a86e&raw">pom.xml

{noformat}
fields.summary: Link Containing Access Token for Download of Individual Files

fields.summary: MySQL connector 5.1.16 fails

fields.description:
My team has been making heavy use of the pull request feature since it was introduced.  One of the constant requests I hear from them is for the ability to use the Diff feature prior to saving the pull request.

The purposes of reviewing the Diff before issuing the pull request:
 - the originator can verify that the proper changes are in the request
 - the originator can identify any conflicts in the request
 - reviewers do not receive 'notification spam' for a pull request that may be invalid/incomplete

Our current workaround for this is:
 - create the pull request without assigning reviewers
 - review the diff on the newly created pull request
 - in case of conflicts, decline the pull request
 - otherwise, edit the pull request and add reviewers
fields.summary: Allow Diff view during pull request creation

fields.description:
Our team doesn't always assign specific reviewers to a pull request. Instead, any team member can review a pull request and mark their approval. 

On the pull request index page, it would be handy to see the avatars of people who have _approved_ the pull request, in addition to whoever is assigned as a reviewer.

Would make it easy to scan for pull requests that are still in need of approval.
fields.summary: View approvers in pull requests index page

fields.description:
In screens that show a list of groups that a particular user is a member of, some users will see error popups or the groups simply won't load.

!http://monosnap.com/image/orqWVl11QIDzYwDFP0IEcjgfe.png!

This is due to some JS that stores the username as an HTML attribute "data-user" and the way jQuery reads these.

We use {{$el.data('user')}}, which for most users returns something like "aahmed". For usernames that are all numbers, like 1234, this returns a number 1234. When the number starts with 0, the 0 is stripped.

Thus when we use that value anywhere, it's incorrect.

We should instead use {{$el.attr('data-user')}}
fields.summary: Profile javascript errors for users with numeric usernames starting with zero

fields.description:
Until the required number of approvals has been received the MERGE button is disabled (grayed out) and the popup over the yellow triangle symbol indicates that you need N more approvals before this pull request can be merged.  When the Approve button is pressed the error message popup isn't updated to reflect the new count needed, and when the final Approval is received the Merge button is not enabled and the error message is not removed.

Refreshing the page will usually get things updated properly, though sometimes it's necessary to reload the pull request. However these updates should happen automatically without these extra manual steps.
fields.summary: Pull requests: Problem with Merge button and Warning messages when N approvals required
